website_summaries.verdict: The best value. Cooks pizza in about half the time as a conventional oven, and produces results that are on par with pricier units.
pros: Works incredibly well on frozen and fresh pizza
Works great on heating leftover pizza, too
cons: Limited usability in that it won't do anything but pizza and a few frozen, pre-made appetizers

website_summaries.verdict: This option has a cool factor  that makes cooking a pizza fun.
pros: Pizza takes about 15 minutes to cook
Also works for a variety of other foods, from chicken fingers to s'mores
Top and bottom heating elements work separately, giving you full control over how this option cooks
cons: be careful with it around children, or your own skin
Pizza cooks well, but does not end up piping hot when done
Has a break-in smell that clears up over time

customer_reviews.title: Loved it when it worked for about 5 months then ...
customer_reviews.text: Loved it when it worked for about 5 months then it just stopped heating up. Called their very rude customer service and they said I have to mail the broken item back to them ($15-25) for them to most likely just try to repair it and send it back to me. Because it is cheap quality, although convenient, I won't be investing another dime into this product..... from all the other reviews that sound just like mine, I would recommend just NOT purchasing this particular product and try to find something similar from a different company. Good Luck!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Plus doesn't always mean better
customer_reviews.text: What were they thinking? I love the Pizzazz original better than the Plus for one very important reason. When you plug it in it doesn't turn on until you set the timer or place the pan on the drive shaft. The plus version immediately engages the fan motor. This requires users to unplug it after every use. This is a complete waste of time and energy, and is not convenient for most consumers. The pizzazz manufacturer needs to consider the consumer before making seemingly illogical changes. My ten-year-old pizzazz still works, its just seen better days. This is still a great oven... with one major design flaw.
customer_reviews.author: cjraye

customer_reviews.title: Too cheap to even put switch on it.
customer_reviews.text: You have to plug into and out of an outlet everytime you use this. Nope! I am not a caveman! In the 21st century we have switches and that turn things on and off. We do not have to beat things with rocks. Put a switch on it and we will talk.
customer_reviews.author: William H.

customer_reviews.title: Where have I been?
customer_reviews.text: I had no idea that this even existed until I heard an advertisement for another similar product on the radio so searched Amazon and found this one. WOW! Perfect pizza! The top gets lightly browned and bubbly while the crust is crispy. I tweaked it a bit for our preference. We have pizza once a week and this has brought that to a whole new level. Clean up too is a breeze. The pan might seem a little flimsy as it’s pretty light weight but it gets the job done. I would certainly recommend this product and after raving about it, my daughter has also purchased one and loves it too!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia H. Russell

customer_reviews.title: Pizza center doesn't cook.
customer_reviews.text: The center of the pizza is still raw even after cooking it for twice as long as written in the instructions. Problem is that there is no heating element directly over the center. Great idea, poor design.
customer_reviews.author: Xi Jing Pooh

customer_reviews.title: Ended up buying one at Walmart been fine since.
customer_reviews.text: It didn’t work out of the box. Made 3/4 of a turn and quit. I know someone else who bought one off amazon same thing. Ended up buying one at Walmart been fine since.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Pizza lovers best friend.
customer_reviews.text: Even after reading all the reviews I was still skeptical The price was a factor but not a huge one so I bought the Presto Pizzazz as a middle of the road choice. Lucky me. This thing is everything it says it is. They all do pizza, probably very well or at least ok. This one does pizza like you get at the pizzaria. Easy operation, rotating pan, chiming timer it will bake or heat any snack you desire. Very pleased with the purchase. This is perfect for frozen pizzas, pizza rolls, nachos, wings, potato skins or whatever you need to bake or heat. I love pizza, this will bake or reheat to perfection. Money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Blackcloud26

customer_reviews.title: Loved my Pizza Pizzaz but it only worked for a few months
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. I ordered it for a Christmas present and we have used it approximately twice a week. I went to heat up a pizza and the both elements are burnt out. It worked fine last time and now nothing. I am so bummed. I have bragged about how great this product is to family and friends and some have since purchased this product. Now, I have to take back all the great things I've said because this is too expensive of a product to work about a dozen times and then burn out.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: Ehh.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because my Samsung oven doesn't like cooking the dough of my frozen pizzas. Our older cheap oven cooked them without issue. It definitely isn't quicker, it takes the same amount of time to not cook the dough of my pizza. I can leave it on there for 40 mins and get a crispy crust but then it's just the weird only very bottom crispy cardboard pizza. It is great at melting cheese. I now basically only use it for melting cheese, warming the frozen garlic bread( browns them nicely). Cleans really easy! Now I need to find a better option (or just an option) for cooking my frozen pizzas
customer_reviews.author: Brandon M. Chambers

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine. I use it for so much more than pizza. I make garlic bread, fish sticks and chicken nuggets to name a few things. I have made cookies on it and reheated a lot of different things. I use it on anything I can, so I don't have to heat up my oven. It has saved me a lot of money, just not heating up my oven. This is the second one I have owned, because I wore out my first one after about 6 years of heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Every household should have one!
customer_reviews.text: I have a couple of friends that have them and thought they were just for making or warming pizza. It is the most used item in one of my friends kitchen and has been for years. After seeing the versatility, ease of use and how great everything came out I finally got my own. Pizza, hash browns, paninis, popcorn shrimp, cheese sticks, chicken nuggets, taquitos, ect. This machine can handle all of it with a better outcome than an oven or fryer! Do yourself a favor and get one for yourself and a gift for someone else!
customer_reviews.author: robert s rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: I thought when I saw pizza pizzazz plus I was getting a better upgraded model
customer_reviews.text: This is the slowest and noisiest kitchen gadget I have ever owned. I bought my first pizza pizzazz about 15 years ago, and when it quit working I couldn't wait to get another one. I thought when I saw pizza pizzazz plus I was getting a better upgraded model. The plus part of it is a misnomer. I can't believe how cheap and awful this thing is. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: michelle bertella

customer_reviews.title: Pizza Pizzazz is Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: Best appliance around for a quick pizza. No heating up the oven. This will cook frozen pizzas as well as homemade. Just put the pizza on the turn- table and plug it in. Set the timer to time listed on your pizza box but watch to see if that much time is really needed. It will usually cook before the oven could preheat to the desired temperature. It cooks the top and bottom of the pizza at the same time. If you buy the square thincrust style pizza, just trim the corners and place corners on the tray. The turn-table is easy to clean and can be stored away to minimize space on your countertop.
customer_reviews.author: Linda W. Crowson

customer_reviews.title: Stay away!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this zero stars I would. I tried cooking 5 different pizzas on this thing and all of them were both under cooked and burned. Either the toppings get over done or the bottom does but it never cooks in the middle. This is the worst product I’ve bought. The good reviews suckered me in. I can’t return it either because I no longer have the box and as a disabled person it’s hard for me to get to the post office. Worst purchase of 2020.
customer_reviews.author: Jen Warren

customer_reviews.title: More than pizza
customer_reviews.text: Don't think about it, buy it. The name may make you think pizza but this heats up anything. Chicken strips, jalapeno poppers, taquitos, mini burgers from Chili's, Sausage egg and cheese biscuits that you forgot you had but luckily found one morning after a week of not going to the grocery store and basically sustaining yourself on ice cream and ramen. This thing cooks pizza better than the oven. No joke.
customer_reviews.author: Batfanatic

customer_reviews.title: 12 years of service - still my favorite pizza maker !
customer_reviews.text: bought this in 2008, still working great in 2020! Pan has a glaze on it so it's a dark brown now instead of the grey non stick finish it came with. but still is easy to remove the pizza from the surface. I like to break my frozen pizza into 6 pieces before cooking, this way I can arrange the broken pieces to avoid the center "dot" on the pan that does not cook as well. 12 years of service - still my favorite pizza maker !
customer_reviews.author: northfront

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with fresh dough pizzas
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how this machine works with frozen pizzas but I know it doesn't work to good with homemade, fresh dough, pizzas. I normally make enough dough in a bread machine for 3 pizzas, which I put in the oven all at the same time to save on having the oven on for to long. I bought this thinking it would save energy, rather then heaving the oven on. But like I said with the fresh dough pizza it takes roughly 40 minutes for the pizza to get as done as it's going to get. which isn't to good. It cooks in the center of the pizza but not around the edge
customer_reviews.author: Reuven

customer_reviews.title: Great all around table top cooker.
customer_reviews.text: Made a frozen pizza and it came out hot and delicious. Tried an experiment. Picked up some large portabella mushrooms to stuff. Whipped up my lobster stuffing... seasoned Italian bread crumbs, chopped seasoned croutons, butter and chopped imitation crab legs. Added melted butter to ingredients and mixed well. Removed stems and gills from mushrooms added stuffing and cooked in Presto for around 12 minutes. Stuffing came out golden brown and mushrooms were tender and tasty. I would suggest the Presto pizazz to anyone looking for a great table top cooker.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Simply Incredible
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd unit that I have owned. I wore the first one out. I could go on and on about how incredible this thing is. It cooks pizzas perfectly. The best feature is that you can choose to have only the upper or lower heating elements on separately. This lets you decide how crispy you want the crust to be without burning the toppings. I am planning on buying another one soon. The nice thing is that you can watch it cook so you can decide when to turn it off. The only thing that I would like to see would be 2 speeds for each heating element. This thing cooks all kinds of other things as well.
customer_reviews.author: ThePostmaster

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: My godson was at our house for a football game and we used our pizza plus to make pizza. He thought it was awesome so we got him one for Christmas. He is a HS senior and will use it at college. This machine is used 5 times a week at our house. It’s not just for pizza.
customer_reviews.author: Fred D.

customer_reviews.title: Lasted two months and died
customer_reviews.text: Bought in December and died today. My last one lasted 4 years.
customer_reviews.author: Lee S

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.text: We bought one and also received a second as a gift. Prior to using them, I thought I'd wind up giving one away. Nope! We definitely needed two in our house! (Hungry teen boys) We use this for most things we would normally bake appetizer-wise in the over. Pizza, fries, pizza rolls, tater tots, etc. It makes them perfectly every time. Golden, crispy crusts. I can even reheat pizza and it tastes fresh. The only downside is having to balance food perfectly as the tray isn't stable at all. I has one small pivot point so the tray will tip if it's not evenly loaded.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's a no for me.....
customer_reviews.text: Recieved this on 1/14 and up until today 3/29, I would have given it a glowing review. My son and I love pizza, so we use this often and it has worked great! We have cooked wings, pizza, rewarmed pizza, cheese sticks and a few other things to date. Loved. Today though, we set it up to cook a pizza and it no longer spins continuously, so I am glad I waited to write a review because 50 bucks for something to work for two months isn't my idea of a great product. It is making an "almost" full circle and then hanging up and it won't move unless you help it. So disappointed. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: SimplyShannon

customer_reviews.title: DEAD AFTER 19 WEEKS
customer_reviews.text: We bought our first Presto 03430 Pizzazz Plus Rotating Oven several years ago. My wife doesn’t like things setting out, but we used it so much, she allowed me to leave it setting on our rolling butcher block. It lasted almost 3 years, with almost daily use, and when it died, I was online ordering a new one before the old one even had a chance to cool down. Because of a change in my diet, we've used the new one less, and it only lasted 19 weeks (4 months, 16 days).

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: between this, a frydaddy, forman grill, fridge, freezer, microwave and nutribullet at work I can make almost anything! totally awesome product, my lunches are down to about $3 each and amazingly better than any fast food near my work , all fits ontop of my toolbox that I'd just clutter with useless stuff anyway! Saves me oodles of money and actually makes me eat healthier throughout the month
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Quirky and take up a lot of space.
customer_reviews.text: As other reviewers note. It does not shut off when the timer expires, it just keeps spinning, so you have to unplug it. If you set it for under 4 minutes it does not cook (but it spins! It always spins whenever it's plugged in!) All these are complaints of others. So why did I buy? Because it looks big. I thought I could heart a few slices at once. Boy was I wrong! It only fits 2 full size slices at a time but it takes up more space than a toaster oven. Big and quirky. I do not recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Prince Michael

customer_reviews.title: Pizzazz Plus Rotating Oven
customer_reviews.text: I had one a long time ago and always wanted to get another. Much faster and less energy to do a pizza. The 1 star drop is because unless I completely missed it you have to unplug it after each use because the turntable turns on once plugged in without moving the timer. And for anything that takes 4 minutes or less you have to first turn the dial pass 4 minutes then back to 4 minutes or less to cook your item. It's always the small things that make or break a product. It is what it is but something that should be so simple...
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: This is amazing!
customer_reviews.text: My college age daughter told me about this as her roommate brought one for their college apartment. Wow is all I can say. We haven’t used our big oven in the 2 months I’ve had it. Works great with pizza, cinnamon rolls, made nachos last night you name it. For a $39 kitchen appliance we’re super happy with it. Clean up is almost nonexistent. Love it .
customer_reviews.author: Tinkey

customer_reviews.title: I ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS PIZZAZZ
customer_reviews.text: LET ME START BY SAYING I CAN NOT BELIEVE THIS MACHINE DOES WHAT IT DOES. I HAVE COOKED WINGS , CHICKEN,GREEN BEANS,SQUASH,ZUCCINI, HAMBURGERS, HOT DOGS, I HAVE PUT PLAIN SANDWHICH MEAT ON IT AND MELTED CHEESE OVER IT . EVEN BROCCOLI . I ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS PIZZAZZ. I ALSO BOUGHT ONE FOR MY DAUGHTER AND SHE LOVES IT AND SHE SAID SHE MADE COOKIES ON IT AS WELL. UNBELIEVABLE THINGS THIS DOES. IT SAFE AND EFFECTIVE. I AM FIXING TO ORDER A FEW MORE FOR GIFTS. SO IF YOU ARE THINKING ABOUT THIS AND WONDERING IF ITS WORTH IT .. TRUST ME GET IT
customer_reviews.author: Jacque reid

customer_reviews.title: Pick something else
customer_reviews.text: Decided to buy this after reading the reviews. I wish I hadn’t. I would find a different pizza oven. It cooks a top far faster than the bottom, but even if you have it set to cook on Just the bottom, the crust is never quite right. We have tried several different crusts on this and we’re still very unhappy. Homemade and frozen pizza. I would recommend a pizza oven where you actually slide your pizza into the drawer rather than one that cooks in a circle like this. Not made very well either. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer P

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the original.
customer_reviews.text: I had the original version that came from Walmart years ago. It does basically the same thing. But, this one is no where near as sturdy. I don"t see it holding up like the original. It pops, creaks and sags as it turns. It is hard to get the pan on the turntable. Other than lesser construction, it cooks pizza just as good as the original. I just don't see this being a long lasting product.
customer_reviews.author: Ric Hatch

customer_reviews.title: No power swith...are you kidding
customer_reviews.text: Works great but you have to yank the plug out of the wall every time you use it. Amazed that this can be sold this way. Still...it works great.
customer_reviews.author: DaveT

customer_reviews.title: Unstable rotation plate
customer_reviews.text: I don’t like the fact that when you place a pizza pan on the turntable it is wobbly and has a tendency to tilt and you spend the rest of the cooking time trying to keep the pan in the middle of the rotating tray. I would not recommend this product nor would I ever buy another one. Just my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: James w.

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient countertop pizza cooker
customer_reviews.text: I love this pizza oven. It cooks my pizza just the way I like it, without using as much electricity as my oven, and without overheating my house, thus making it harder on my air conditioner to cool my house during the hot summer. In addition to that, it will warm up other types of food, like tator tots and French fries.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Love, Love, Love!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant at first to spend $40 on a pizza oven that I didn’t have a need for. Boy am I glad I bought it!! This is easily the most used appliance in our kitchen and we use it for so many meals! We often cook pizza, frozen appetizers (potato skins, mozzarella sticks, etc), as well as pizza bagels, cookies, you name it! The Pizzazz is so much quicker to use than the traditional oven, and is amazingly versatile! We bought ours about six months ago and it is still holding up very well after almost daily uses. This product is built to last and very high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Kennard

customer_reviews.title: ADD SOME PIZAZZ TO YOUR LIFE
customer_reviews.text: Why has it taken us this long to buy a pizazz???? If you serve your kids chicken nuggets on the regular (don’t judge) then this is a MUST!!! If I don’t have to plan meals ahead just for the sake of preheating the oven then YES PLEASE. If I don’t have to heat the house up just to make chicken nuggets then YES PLEASE. We have had this for over a week and have made: Nuggets, fries, tater tots, pizza, toasted our sandwiches, soft pretzels AMAZING! ADD SOME PIZAZZ TO YOUR LIFE
customer_reviews.author: Hilary

customer_reviews.title: No oven? Get a Pizzazz!
customer_reviews.text: I use this daily! I don't have an oven and since I got this three months ago someone in the family has used it EVERY DAY! We use it for quick frozen foods, fresh cut veggies (home made French fries with no grease! ), fish, chicken, pork, etc... my 14 year old uses it to cook tater tots or cheese sticks as a snack after school. Even if this doesn't last(like some reviews said) it already paid for itself. 12 inch pizzas, bagel bites, 3-4 personal pizzas... this has earned its own counter space. *update, purchased Dec 28, 2018 &finally died March 30, 2020. Ordered a new one same day. Still a daily use item.
customer_reviews.author: Ladybug

customer_reviews.title: Stops working if to hot
customer_reviews.text: It worked great at first, but if the food gets on the aluminum lip it's hard to get off. Heat resistor tripped and then it stops working. It's not easy to fix because it's rivited. Not something most people can fix.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Willbur

customer_reviews.title: Durable pizza maker that is still producing after 5 years
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful product that we have had now for 5 years. It still cooks the best frozen pizza of any device still out. It has withstood time and has taken a beaten. We continue to still use it and even run the pizza cutting wheel on it and it still has been great. I would recommend this product as it does make a frozen pizza into its best version because it cooks and crisps from the top and bottom which is needed especially when cooking rising crust pizzas.
customer_reviews.author: luke fichtner

customer_reviews.title: The Great Kitchen Appliance I Didn't Know I Needed, but I Did!
customer_reviews.text: Husband talked me into buying it, which in itself is unusual. I'm usually the kitchen queen. And it's not like we eat pizza every night either. But this thing is so versatile, we cook lots of stuff on it that we'd normally cook in the oven, without having to wait 15 minutes for the warm up. Love it. Would buy it again. And PS It also bakes a great pizza!
customer_reviews.author: Psych Buff

customer_reviews.title: We use this thing for everything, not just Pizza
customer_reviews.text: It works awesome for pizza, cheese sticks, chicken tenders, etc. The only complaint is that cleaning the pan part is nearly impossible. The dimples in it have so much junk burnt into them, you can't get it out. Have to scrape each little dimple. Would be nice if the non stick was better or a flatter pan design.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: This machine ABSOLUTELY ROCKS! No worries about cheese dripping in oven, cooks frozen pizzas perfectly! It doesn’t take up much room and pizza pan super easy to clean. We LOVE IT SO MUCH we’ve eaten far more Emil’s Frozen Pizzas than we should! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Janie D.

customer_reviews.title: Recommend for pizza and frozen foods
customer_reviews.text: Took me a one try to realize how to use it. Just set the time to what it says on instructions. We cooked chicken nuggets and pizza on here. All turned out great. Super easy. Just set it on tray and set time. It starts immediately. No waiting. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Buy it.
customer_reviews.text: My wife's parents own one of these and I had to get one for ourselves. I love the fact that you don't have to preheat the oven for anything you need to bake. We primarily bake pizza on it but have made taquitos and quesadillas on it and will soon be trying cookies and cinnamon rolls. If it broke I would buy it again in a second. The only thing I don't like is the timer knob seems flimsy and on this model, you have to really push down and turn to set it. The original version you just turned it. Not a deal breaker in the least but I'm picky.
customer_reviews.author: ItsCorpsBoy!!!

customer_reviews.title: DANGEROUS TO USE PIZZA BAKER
customer_reviews.text: POORLY DESIGNED ATTACHMENT OF TURNTABLE TO HEATING UNIT. DANGEROUS...SHOULD NOT BE USED BY CHILDREN PR ELDERLY. BAKES PIZZA OK AND QUICKLY. THINK MY OVEN DOES IT BETTER AND JUST AS QUICK (19 MINUTES -- NO PRE-HEATING). MANUFACTURER SHOULD REDESIGN THE CONNECTING DEVICE. HOW ABOUT MAGNETIC?
customer_reviews.author: Robert D. Nostrand

customer_reviews.title: Bought one for every member of my family
customer_reviews.text: I bought myself a Pizzazz when it first came out years ago. I still have it to this day and it works great. Just need to get a new tray as it is rusting a little. Use this at least 2 times per week since I bought it. I have bought one for every member of my family. Everyone swears by this. No need to preheat an oven. It cooks anything from pizza to quesadillas to grilled cheese, the list goes on and on. Makes amazing pizza puffs. Nice and crispy crusts. Even cooks deep dish frozen pizzas!
customer_reviews.author: LStowe

customer_reviews.title: A disappointing oven.
customer_reviews.text: If you are a fan of well-baked fresh pizza, made in less than a few minutes in a high temperature oven, then you will NOT love the Pizazz. The Pizazz will either dry out your pizza and its topping or undercook it to an unappetizing doughy waste of time and money. All my efforts to improve the results by manipulating the timing and the baking areas failed. For me, it’s back to my 550°F gas oven and pizza stone.
customer_reviews.author: H. S. Gersten

customer_reviews.title: BEST KITCHEN GADGET EVER
customer_reviews.text: I ended up buying this after seeing this at my friends house. I literally use this not just to make pizza, but reheat any food that I would typically use a conventional oven for, or even an air fryer for. I haven't used any of my other kitchen gadgets since I got this. I absolutely love it and bought 2 more to give as gifts!
customer_reviews.author: C Shah

customer_reviews.title: Great invention - wife and kids love it
customer_reviews.text: My wife saw our neighbor use this to cook up some chicken tenders and it was over. She had to have one and next thing you know it showed up at our door the next day. We've put many miles on this thing like you'd see someone using a dehydrator. Pizza, tenders, hot dogs, cheese balls, breaded mushrooms, veggies, and whatever you can fit underneath this thing, she's put there and we've eaten. You'll love it and it's worth the price. Just have to see how long it will last. It's pretty sturdy, so I think she may end up passing it down a generation or two.
customer_reviews.author: NJD & DMD

customer_reviews.title: Keep it out on the counter!
customer_reviews.text: After a friend recommended this I looked at and it was a toy that wouldn't cook anything very well. I was wrong! This thing is amazing! We use it all the time now for pizza, taquitos, spring rolls, pizza, quesadillas, cheese crisps and even pizza. Very easy to clean. Take the wheel off and stand it up behind the unit to store it on the counter. You won't want to put it far away because you will be using often. It's fun to watch too.
customer_reviews.author: Jim M.

customer_reviews.title: One of the greatest kitchen appliance I’ve purchased.
customer_reviews.text: I like the complete versatility of this item. Our oven is done right now so we rely on a toaster oven and when I was told about this by a few co workers I had to have one. I cooks pizzas to perfection every time. I’ve even gone beyond pizza and made cookies that come out perfectly. The only issue I have come across is the counter space it takes up when not in use, the unit itself is compact, the turn table/ cooking surface takes up some space. But I would recommend this to anyone who wants pizza or other baked goods without heating up the entire house.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Making pizzas is so much easier with this thing! They come out better and now my apartment is overheated from using the oven. I cook lots of other food items on this as well, and they all come out great. Super easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: It's worth it for the buck if you are really patient get one now!
customer_reviews.text: OMG Beast Champion Pizza Baker 11/11 the best pizza oven I ever own in 2020 if you don't have one 100% for sure you should buy one for those people who has patient when it come to food. Good for everything melt all the cheese on the top bottom extra crispy very delicious for me it's pretty quick, and simple 100% easy to clean as well better then a convection oven plus you save 60% energy more buy one now!
customer_reviews.author: Chidori

customer_reviews.title: Works wonderful on so much more than pizza
customer_reviews.text: Not only does this make the cheap pizzas good. You can use it on so much more. I make cinnamon rolls out of those popping tubes. I make my own cheese quesadilla , garlic toast, I have even cooked kielbasa sausage on here. I just cut it in half face down worked great. If you are thinking about it just buy it no regrets!
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn R.

customer_reviews.title: A must have for any kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Cooks pizzas, onion rings, popcorn shrimp, french fries and anything else meant to be baked in an oven - without having to heat up the oven and the house. I first bought one twenty years ago when I first moved to Phoenix and was in a furnished apartment. There was only an electric stove top and no oven. I found the pizzazz at a local store and was able to cook pizzas for the two months there. This original unit finally failed after twenty years of use. It works so well, it is my primary wedding gift that I prefer to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Kristopher Staller

customer_reviews.title: Great pizza cooker at great price
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing . It makes perfect pizzas! Apparently it’s capable of doing much more but do far I’ve only used it for pizza’s and they come out great! And you can’t beat the price or ease of clean up. And unlike other pizza coolers out there, no glass doors to explode on you like many of the convection oven style are reviewed as having had happen. Once again I am so pleased!!
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Wilcox so pleased

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I like this product. Cooks frozen and fresh pizza great!. No need to heat up an entire oven. I would recommend it for an easy way to re- heat or cook frozen pizza and other items. Quick clean up. The pizza tray does seat itself, but is still a bit wobbly. I think the stem to hold the tray could be larger. It is bulky and hard to store away. That is the only draw back I have found. Would also purchase as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: cruella99

customer_reviews.title: Better than an oven
customer_reviews.text: I borrowed my mom's and had to go and buy one. Love the way it cooks pizzas, much more evenly than a traditional oven. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because it leaves the middle not as cooked as the outer parts. Pretty much 95% of the pizzas you buy at the store are way smaller than the pan. I have to move the pizza around about 3/4 of the way through cooking to get the center cooked properly. If the upper heating element went out a tad farther, this wouldn't be a problem. But, in the end, it still cooks a damn good pizza, just with a little more work.
customer_reviews.author: Bkaips

customer_reviews.title: NY-style tortilla pizzazz comes out good
customer_reviews.text: It was a little tricky at first, learning how to balance the cooking tray so it would rotate. Also, timing the heat elements. I can say though that this makes the best ultra thin crust pizzas by using giant tortillas. The unsauced far edges dry light and crisp, while the crust takes on a nice color on the underside leaving plenty of chew. I place a 12 inch tortilla on the cook tray, spread 1/4c sauce 1/2 cup shredded cheeses and let it go for 14 or so min. The last 6min I switch off the bottom heat while only leaving the top on.
customer_reviews.author: Alberto

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, superior results!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic machine! This is my third bread machine and my first Hamilton-Beach. Superior results over the previous machines. The very first loaf was perfect even though I had to make a substitution in the recipe, and I was making gluten-free bread, which can be very temperamental. Much easier to use than previous machines, including one that was substantially more expensive. Very happy with this product and highly recommend it. UPDATE: Second loaf of bread was even better than the first because I followed the directions more closely.
customer_reviews.author: Gustavo Reed

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it because of all the 5 star reviews. But little disappointed. First you need to pre bake the pizza dough in order to cook completely. And it’s not crispy crust its soft crust , and the edge of the pizza it’s always looks undercook . It actually cooked but if you keep it longer the cheese gets burn . I definitely like the oven cooked pizza . I still using it in the summer because my oven get my room too hot and I live in the dessert.
customer_reviews.author: Lovelynest

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product that can cook more than pizza!
customer_reviews.text: I live in a duplex and my neighbor/ friend’s oven broke and he would bug me to make him his frozen pizza and fries every other day. Ughhh.. After a couple weeks I had enough and convinced him to give me the money to get this thing. I had one of these in high school and loved it! (Now I cook real food lol.) Haven’t seen him since giving it to him. It’s great!
customer_reviews.author: Gypsylala

customer_reviews.title: How did we live without this
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Have only had a few weeks but have used many times already. Pizza, pizza rolls, fries/ tator tots, frozen breaded chicken strips. Pan easy to wipe clean. Device comes in a large box but it's not really so bulky. Pan is removable so it's not difficult to store. Makes even a cheap pizza taste better. Fries so crisp. Bought one for a family member gift already.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Even cooking. Timing perfect
customer_reviews.text: If you do not own a wood fired brick oven the pizzazz is the next best thing
customer_reviews.author: Squirt Dudgeon

customer_reviews.title: Greatest invention since the pizza itself
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this appliance. Use it most days. Not just for pizza. You can make ANYTHING on it really. It's so fast and easy. And cleanup is a breeze. I hardly ever use my oven anymore. I love the fact that you don't have to wait for it to preheat. And in the summer you don't heat up your whole house making a pizza.
customer_reviews.author: Dayna Drennan

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: I've only had one other Pizzazz. My mom bought it for me years ago. The rotation went out on it a few years ago and I'd had a hard time finding another till I was browsing on Amazon. So glad I found this and the price was incredible. (I managed to catch it right as the price had dropped by $20.00) I jumped on purchasing this and have NOT been disappointed. Works great and does just what I need it to to get the pizzas done. I truly hope this one lasts as long as the last one did. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: wolfpack4

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly WOW!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical at buying this counter cooker. It replaced a Cuisinart toaster oven that old spilled cooking juices may catch fire. The price was worth a try. I have used pizza stones in my hot oven, a stone on my hot BBQ grill (that burned the crust), but then I got a perfect pizza from a brick oven borrowed with a family while living in Ecuador. Ecuador = Round Table! Pizzazz surprisingly cooked as well and even better than my other attempts in the last 20 years. For a good home made 12" pizza at home, this is a smart buy.
customer_reviews.author: faburg

customer_reviews.title: Loved it. Then it finally died
customer_reviews.text: Help help. Had the original pizzazz for nearly 15 years. Loved it. Then it finally died. Bought a new one. Used it about 8 times in a three month period, and then it quit. We spent about $70 And it is broken! Terrible!! Shouldn't even get a one star!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Caution: Expect Less Then A Year Of Use
customer_reviews.text: The Cheap Motor They Use To Rotor/Actuate The Pan Is Only Good For So Many Total Minutes Before It Craps Out. If You Use It More Then 4-5 Times A Week, You'll Be Lucky To Get 9 Months Out Of It Before It Quits. Still Trying To Source Replacement Motors, But The Company Is Refusing To Disclose That Information.
customer_reviews.author: antonrr

customer_reviews.title: BEST WAY TO COOK PIZZA
customer_reviews.text: WE LOVE OUR PIZAZZ SO MUCH ! ITS LITERALLY OUR FRIDAY GO TO FOR DINNER. MAKES THE CRUST SUPER CRUNCHY AND YOU CAN ADJUST THE TOP OR BOTTOM TO COOK JUST THE WAY YOU LIKE IT. WE HAVE USED THIS PIZZAZZ FOR FROZEN PIZZAS, PAPPA MURPHYS AS WELL MADE OUR OWN FROM SCRATCH AND IT NEVER FAILS... YOU HAVE GOT TO BUY ONE. NO MORE ORDERING OUT FOR PIZZA ANY MORE !! SAVE MONEY AND TASTE BETTER TO MAKE YOUR OWN AND ITS QUICK TOO. DONE IN 15-20 MINS MAX. LOVED SO MUCH I PURCHASED ONE FOR MY DAUGHTERS APT.....LOYAL CUSTOMER FOR LIFE~
customer_reviews.author: michelle

customer_reviews.title: A must for any single person, or for those who dont want to warm a whole oven for nuggets
customer_reviews.text: I love my Pizzazz. I purchased this to send as a gift to someone as i loved mine so much. Its perfect for those who dont want to fire up a stove to cook pizzas, or chicken nuggets or just about anything you want. I even know people who have these out in their garage to eat up something while working out there.
customer_reviews.author: Randall W

customer_reviews.title: Time saver plus.
customer_reviews.text: We use this every day. Great especially during the summer when you don't want to have the oven heating up the house. My 8 and 12 year old grandkids use it with minimal supervision. Once it's hot the younger one lets me take over but the 12 year old does it all alone. Pizza is great of course but we've cooked everything on it that we would have used the oven for since we got it home. Corn dogs, chicken nuggets, reheated egg rolls, tater tots, garlic bread and on and on. Looking at that list makes me realize how much junk these guys have been eating lately... We always have fresh fruit in the house I swear!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Frozen  fast and cooked perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly how it was described. My only complaint is that there isn’t an on/off switch, you have to unplug/plug in. But that might be good since I have teenagers who could forget to switch it off.
customer_reviews.author: MGP

customer_reviews.title: Must Buy if you like to cook multiple things and dont want to pay crazy price for dual oven
customer_reviews.text: Was sick of never having the Fries and Pizza come out good cause the single Oven wasn't cutting it. Looked into buying a Dual oven Range and the prices was crazy. Grabbed this in hope of solving the dual items needed to be cooked at the same time and ready together and this thing is great for that. Fries and pizza done together and a second pizza put on after the first and lets just say dinner was finally easy on food was served and ready at the same times. It actually cooked the pizza better than the oven does even when its the only thing in there :p
customer_reviews.author: Craig R Snell Jr

customer_reviews.title: This thing is amazing!!!
customer_reviews.text: My whole family loves this thing. Frozen pizza, nuggets, fries, quesadillas, chicken patties, pizza rolls, bagel bites, etc. I even made a few strips of bacon on this to see how they would turn out. Bacon was great, grease buildup is the only thing that makes it not really doable. I am gifting one of these to all my relatives and friends. Love it
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Bummer
customer_reviews.text: This was my second one. My first one came from Walmart and lasted years! This one lasted only 7 months before it died. So disappointed. I like this product and will replace it, but will go back to Walmart where it's easier to handle 'bummer' products. :(
customer_reviews.author: Arlene Mathews

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing!!
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite products ever. You can make sooo much more than pizza on here and it cooks things so evenly every single time. It's especially awesome for leftover pizza, french fries, chicken tenders, garlic bread, even cookies (make sure you use parchment paper for the cookies though!) just about anything you can heat up in an oven can be made on the pizzazz. I usually follow the package directions for conventional oven and our foods are perfect every time!
customer_reviews.author: Ru

customer_reviews.title: A kitchen appliance that you will actually USE
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for my old one, which we KEEP finding new uses for. Makes ANY frozen pizza that I've tried taste much better. Get a decent one (Digiorno or similar) and it is amazing how well it works. Reading the new manual, they have cooking times on all manner of items. I hope this one is as durable as the old one, it lasted 15-20 years.
customer_reviews.author: mofella

customer_reviews.title: Best Kitchen Appliance Ever !
customer_reviews.text: Believe it or not, I purchased this oven March 22, 2006. About twice a month my buddies and me have pizza & beer night outside on the picnic table in front of my workshop. What a hoot. This oven is the best most reliable kitchen appliance I’ve ever purchased. The group has grown to the point I need to purchase a second one. By the way, the ladies have gotten into it too. We start out with a Margarita pizza for them. They love it. Fast, Clean, Easy & Simple. Buy it. Standard Equipment for a Man Cave.
customer_reviews.author: Mike B. Florida

customer_reviews.title: very wobbly cooking pan but fast cooking
customer_reviews.text: It cooks very fast but I do not like how wobbly the cooking pan is. I will use but if I need new one in the future I will purchase a different brand. It cooks pizza a lot faster and evenly. I like the fact there is not need to preheat the oven.
customer_reviews.author: Hope Christman

product_meta.title: Presto 03430 Pizzazz Plus Rotating Oven
product_meta.description:
The fast and easy way to bake frozen, homemade, take-and-bake, and deli pizza. Also great for preparing frozen convenience foods such as chicken nuggets, jalape–o poppers, fish fillets, egg rolls, cinnamon rolls, cookies and much more. Rotating tray turns continuously to assure even baking. Top and bottom heating elements bake foods from both sides. Heating elements are separately controlled, allowing you to select top, bottom, or both elements for perfect results every time. Timer signals end of cooking time and automatically turns off heating elements. Save as much as 60% in energy compared to a conventional oven. Nonstick pan is removable for easy cleanup and storage. 120 volts AC, 6o Hz only, 1235 watts

AMAZON.COM
This 1,235-watt countertop oven makes pizza in about half the time required by a conventional oven. You don't need to preheat it--it begins rotating and baking the moment you plug it in. There are independently controlled top and bottom heating elements, so all types (frozen or fresh) and sizes (7 to 12 inches) of pizza can be custom baked. With a rising-crust pizza, for example, you should run the lower heating element for 10-12 minutes before turning on the top element. For a crisper crust, bake the pizza with both heating elements, then finish it off with a few minutes of bottom-only heating. For extra cooking time on your toppings, leave the top element on a little longer. A timer with automatic shutoff lets you set cooking times precisely, and a cooking-time guide for various pizza types is printed on the pizza maker. For safety, the appliance shuts off automatically if it overheats. With the 13-1/4-inch-diameter baking pan in place, the pizza maker is 13-1/4 inches wide, 9-1/2 inches high, and 17-1/2 inches deep. (The baking pan can be removed for more compact storage.) It carries a two-year warranty against defects. --Fred Brack
feature_bullets: Rotating tray turns continuously to assure even baking.
Top and bottom heating elements bake foods from both sides. Heating elements are separately controlled, allowing you to select top, bottom, or both elements for perfect results every time.
Timer signals end of cooking time and automatically turns off heating elements.
Saves as much as 60% in energy compared to a conventional oven.
Removable nonstick baking pan is easy to clean and store.
